metadata.title: CVE-2021-20225 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: A flaw was found in grub2 in versions prior to 2.06. The option parserallows an attacker to write past the end of a heap-allocated buffer bycalling certain commands with a large number of specific short forms ofoptions. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to dataconfidentiality and integrity as well as system availability.

criterions.comment: grub2-signed: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
grub2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
